intro: Cleidion sylvestre, commonly known as the wild sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its bark is thick and often fissured, providing a rugged appearance. The plant is adapted to humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests.
